documents.document: Oh ye gods, what a finish #NZvsAUS
@markmywordsAM just imagine if it was Ian Healy. You've got a long way to go
To all my Wellington friends who are working while I enjoy Auckland Anniversary Day I say: ha ha ha ha ha.
Spark was down so I was forced to read a book. A book! It was on my kindle but still; a book! I feel older already.
We're having a sing through of The Mikado. It sounds fantastic! If I wasn't in it I'd be booking my tickets already. Hint hint.
Did something foolish. Couldn't sleep. Got up. Fixed problem. Now tired from worrying about said, easily fixed, issue. Hate own brain
It begins! At Wellington airport about to fly to Auckland for Mikado rehearsals. Excited to be singing again and to rejoin my colleagues
@SarahKSilverman you could argue that his heart and mind were already closed, and no amount of facts could change it
The "love of people/disgust of the human race" dichotomy is starting to really hurt my brain.

I definitely had this feeling when I watched the speech at the CIA.
https://t.co/ilh1WIUGa8
@wendypooh my take: there's nothing like other people's children to make you realise you never want to be a parent.
Too. Much. Wine. Too. Much. Cheese.
@markmywordsAM do we have a stat on how many times Raval has been dropped in test career? Gotta be at least 6! What would his average be?
Saw Jekyll & Hyde at Circa tonight. Really funny and entertaining. Worth your time and your dollars, Wellington.
About to be a pretend patient for doctors exams. Always an interesting day; good to see how smart kids react under pressure!
So much wrong with this picture. Who writes in a suit? Why do you have Islamic curtains? And that ornament on his râ€¦ https://t.co/A5XTugKO7I
@TVietor08 when you say Pod Save America quickly (like on your suit promo) it sounds like Positive America. Which is nice
@VictorianPurple sharing! Getting ready to go to the vet on Wednesday. https://t.co/12YYjjtj8R
@dritchie do all of the songs sound like they're being played through a toilet?
Surely that's good advice every day..... https://t.co/vM1LAVbv6G
Across Newtown. Somewhere in there is my house! https://t.co/KB60p24jAr
Other side of the harbour also fantastic https://t.co/16xqnz03B7
Wellington's south coast looking beautiful this morning https://t.co/Ah9v9KiSw0
I've said it before and I'll say it again: anytime I want to listen to Queen I put a Muse album on.
It's January the 2nd and already my NY resolution to stop counting the days has gone out the window
@TourismAotearoa Ha! I'm finding performing pretty good at the moment
@HappyDarling @AmyMek there's tremendous use of quotation marks and capital letters there
Everyday is a public holiday in #catworld https://t.co/4qxnt41kNi
@gtiso they always remove it when it goes too low or high, or else we might think it's a foregone conclusion and switch off
@dritchie @VictorianPurple rule 1, we tell no one about fight club. Stops. Walks away.
@VictorianPurple introductory joke, concise content, closing joke (topping first joke), drop mic, walk off
@HousefromDC @SportsGuy33 shouldn't All-Star voting take into account the previous playoffs? Hence: Harden
Got caught in a rainstorm, made it home to discover a decapitated bird #catowner
That was an absolute clinic. A great, great partnership @BLACKCAPS #NZvPAK
I went for a nap and when I woke up Wellington had disappeared! #fogageddon
@gtiso man, it's going to be hard to find one of those
Woke up Xmas morning with the sound of the call to prayer echoing over Riyadh. Amazing! Peace and joy to everyone today, of all faiths.
@jacko2323 forget Ireland, come live in New Zealand. Yankee games start at lunchtime, and we have hobbits!
Every time I see Scott Wills playing the role of "old man technophobe" in that ad a little part of me dies #hesnotthatold
The last line of this story's a cracker https://t.co/56yz3r0jbP
#ohwhatafeeling #savethenix At Adelaide Oval, showing our support. https://t.co/c9ZZSjdhBD
@JamesNokise just shows you need a good feed
@AndrewPaulWood @KatydidNZ wow! Thanks Andrew. Surprising there's no sign anywhere with any information
@AndrewPaulWood @KatydidNZ on a reserve at the end of Quebec St, Mornington. On City to Sea walkway
Went for a walk to clear my head and found this out the back of Mornington. Any info anyone? #whywellington https://t.co/FdSECXCX9N
@publicaddress @JamesNokise #ingoffwetrust
@StatGuyGreg nah, stay philosophical. We all must look into the void sometimes
Football in Wellington https://t.co/gI9aYK9pFZ
Smithy looks like he would like to talk about anything other than Johnson #AUSvNZ
Disappointed Mitch is retiring. I was looking forward to watching him get hit all round Adelaide #AUSvNZ
Oi! There's someone pretty important sitting in front of Valetta on the balcony #AUSvNZ
ALISON MAU: Michelle Boag, when is it okay for victims to speak up? - Story - News - RadioLIVE https://t.co/KFY1NUa07W
Pleasant surprise: new Cheap Heat podcast shows up for my walk home tonight. Thanks @AKATheMaskedMan @Rosenbergradio @StatGuyGreg
Sometimes all that's left to do is lie around listening to sad songs
Rocky (shore) #kiwifilms
@toby_etc thanks Toby. The singing voice comes in handy sometimes
@FranOSullivan I used to be an opera singer. Training is everything!
@misspiphall well I have to follow you after that sweet comment!
@VictorianPurple winning the Arts & Culture award at the #WOINZ awards 2015. So proud! @BATS_Theatre https://t.co/WjpEaI1kUB
@Morgan_Jones I wouldn't argue against that. Saw him live a few years ago. Amazing, and enjoyably curmudgeonly
This isn't breaking news but Richard Thompson can really play guitar
On top of everything; we won our cricket match today. Our season so far: 1 for 1. Those were also my bowling figures (off 4 overs). #stoked
Drummond Street, Newtown. Who is responsible for the giant pigeons? I love 'em #whywellington https://t.co/LHucWpK5D7
View from my hotel balcony. Cheers for the great digs Millennium Rotorua! https://t.co/W0oiTfasfv
I was nervous watching the All Blacks. I was just made more jangly watching The Walk. Amazing film - get to it in 3D if you can
Tremendous stuff at Circa Theatre. Great script, direction and performances. Get to Ache people of Wellington! #WhyWellington #acheplay
If John Key and David Cameron get together do they compare pigtails?
Reason @VictorianPurple is the best #126: she paused making my birthday cake to bring me breakfast in bed. And my b'day isn't til Wednesday!
@BillSimmons or betting against Peyton?
@BillSimmons and now? Agree that Manning ain't what he was, but still think he's got a lot to offer
Auckland I am in you. I'm hoping for mutual pleasure
@caitlinmoran @petepaphides no Crowded House song is ever forgotten in New Zealand. You should come and visit the land of Finn
A fine time at Lux Festival in Wellington. My personal faves were on the Opera House wall and the water projections. Get to it, Welli-ites!
Just saw Tampopo as part of #wellyonaplate. A film to try and see. Bonkers! And we've been inspired to have dinner at The Ramen Shop
Experienced the PignPinot event at La Boca Loca. Goodness me, I need a nap now! #WhyWellington
Burger for breakfast? Definitely! Especially when it's the goose burger from Goose Shack #WhyWellington
A rainbow checks into Capital City Motor Lodge. There's no accounting for taste #WhyWellington http://t.co/WR7sOpYDoA
At the Hannah's Laneway Commons as part of Wellington on a Plate. Good times! http://t.co/ZpqkllQ25a
Well, Belief was terrific. If you missed it at #NZIFF then try to see it when it rolls around again. Or when it goes on telly
Time to go to my final film of the #NZIFF - Belief. By all accounts I'm going to find it disturbing. Can't wait!
@dritchie just when they think they know the answers you change the questions
@dritchie the police should save time and money and consult you on all crime
@HaggisKiwi should you be crossing when the light is orange? Maybe wait til it's red
And this morning. I got up, fed them, then came back to bed. Immediately surrounded #catowner http://t.co/QQKKYwtfz2
I've returned home and normality has been restored #catowner http://t.co/T37tHWZGQF
Excited that I met my Fitbit goals for today just by doing my job. Reconsidering life priorities
A glorious day to be in Christchurch to talk about tourism. Already been given a few opinions from the local taxi drivers #alwayslistening
@AndrewVossy great to have you back at Mt Smart. Your calls always improve the games - the call for the Friend play was classic
Because it's always great to get home, especially on such a beautiful day #WhyWellington
Dunedin, I am in you and soggy with nostalgia. A lot of things happened to me in this city, especially seeing as I never actually lived here
I'm fascinated by the amount of people drinking in Koru Lounge at lunchtime on a Thursday
@kiwimatt001 that traffic signals were designed with longer go times for cars than people
@VictorianPurple I'm overwhelmed with the cuteness
@CommsatTIA I'm disappointed that I missed out. There's been more flights cancelled here today so fingers crossed I'm there tomorrow
Let's be honest: #queenstown is not the worst place in the world to be stranded in. However, my bank account needs me to get home today!
Bridge jump completed! I won't be getting the video though: I don't need my initial cowardice immortalised
It's another glorious day in #queenstown. I think I'll go throw myself off a bridge #bungy
OMG the food at Blue Kanu restaurant in Queenstown is amazing. Take a group so you can sample everything on the menu!
You'd be hard-pressed to find a more beautiful landing than Queenstown in the winter
#FoodAnEightiesSong Livin' on a Pear
